The real woman behind Broadchurch ’s rape storyline has blasted Apple Tree Yard for the way it portrayed sexual assault. 
The ITV drama’s third series started on TV last night with Trish - played by Julie Hesmondhalgh - reporting she’d been raped to the police. 
And rape victim Juliet Marsh helped Broadchurch make the story as realistic as possible. 
But, speaking on This Morning, she compared the series to BBC’s recent drama Apple Tree Yard - which also focused around rape, with a shocking attack in the first episode. Read More Juliet Marsh is the real rape victim behind Broadchurch Julie Hesmondhalgh portrayed Trish who was raped in the new series Juliet said she played it amazingly And she said everything was accurate 
Speaking about watching Broadchurch last night, she told Phillip Schofield and Holly Willoughby: “It was like stepping back in time, mind-blowingly accurate to the detail, when they were taking evidence. 
“The difference between this and Apple Tree Yard was with Apple Tree Yard, I had no idea that rape was going to be the case and it transported me back. 
“I kind of wish they had a warning.” 
Juliet revealed she’d been raped through a date-rape drug in a club, and doesn’t remember anything - having actually been told by the police - and she implored rape victims to report it. 
She said: “When it happened, I was processing it really slowly. 
“I couldn’t fathom it, asking, ‘Why is my body hurting where it’s hurting? I’ve got injuries.’ Read More But she compared it to Apple Tree Yard (Photo: BBC) She was upset there was no warning (Photo: BBC) 
“I called the police, and they were amazing. 
“I never said I was raped, they told me I had been.” 
She added: “Make the call and it will be investigated. 
“It is never your fault. There’s still a social stigma surrounding rape. 
“If I was beaten up, stabbed or mugged, why should I be ashamed?”
